therapyJourney: Therapy is a start of a journey and we're honoured that you've chosen us to start that path.
freeSupport: one free week of unlimited support
myName: Hello, my name is Panagiotis Karagiannis.
myDesc: I'm one of the counsellors on SupportRoom, your online therapy platform.
qna: To let us get to know you better, let's start with a quick questionnaire. This should take about 3 minutes.
emergencyBtnTooltip: If your feeling Suicidal or require immediate support, please visit SupportRoom emergency page
moodBoxDescription: Track how you’re feeling each day
metaContent: Are you a new patient interested in online counselling and therapy? Sign up now as a new patient and discover what we have on offer today.
emergencyText: If your feeling Suicidal or require immediate support, please visit SupportRoom emergency page
changeProfessionalText: If you’re not happy your therapy, change your therapist. Two changes per month
changeProfessionalModalText: Are you sure you want to change Professional?
changeProfessionalExceededText: You have exceeded the limit to change your therapist
signOutheading: Are you sure to Sign Out?
UrgentAlertModal: This will notify your therapist you need immediate support. Alerts are limited to once a day.
wellbeingMeterHeading: Your Moodbox data gets recorded here, in the Wellbeing Meter. You can update your Moodbox every day. Over time, you'll see how things are changing.
dailyTitle: A maximum of 14 days from the start date selected can be shown in the graphs below
weeklyTitle: Please find your mood entries for the last 2 weeks
monthlyTitle: Please find your historical mood entries
seenItAll: Yay! You have seen it all
journalDescription1: Your Journal is a place to write down your thoughts and feelings. Writing things down can help you process how you're feeling. Give it a go - it can be really freeing. You can use your Journal as often as you like. And don't worry about your spelling or grammar - it's not a test.
journalDescription2: Your therapist can read anything you write down here to help them understand how you feel and better address your mental health challenges. Everything you write down here is completely safe and secure - nobody other than your therapist will ever read it. Give it a try.
deleteJournalPara: Are you sure you want to delete this journal?
shareJournalTooltip: Share your journal with your therapist
emailSentMsg: Your email has been sent to the concerned team
noAnnouncements: There are no announcements at the moment
noNotifications: There are no notifications at the moment
anonymousProfileTooltip: Client security is paramount to SupportRoom. Select if you wish to protect your identity from your therapist.
invalidDateFormat: Invalid date, enter date in MM/DD
errorOccurredMessage: An error occurred. Please, try again later.
name: Name:
subject: Subject:
messagePlaceholder:
For any technical support matters, please specify as much information as possible, namely the
previous steps you took before the issue occurred. We also need to know:
Mobile or desktop
IOS or Android
Operating system on desktop (i.e. Windows 10 / IOS etc)
Browser (Chrome, Firefox etc)
Country you are logging in from
checkBoxSelect: Please, select the checkbox to agree Terms & Conditions
errorMessage2: Something went wrong. Try again later.
passwordMustBeLeast6Characters: Password must be at least 6 characters
selectCheckboxText: Please, select the checkbox to agree Terms & Privacy Policy
mobileNumberMinimum10DigitsAllowed: Mobile Number should be min 10 digits long
mobileNumberNumericValues: Mobile number allows only numeric values
passwordContainoneNumericChar: Password must contain at least one numeric character
passwordContainOneUpperCaseChar: Password must contain at least one upper case character
helpText: Use your phone as your Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) when you sign in you’ll be required to use the security code we send you via SMS message.
helpText2: If checked, your real name will be hidden from your therapist.
urgentHelpText: If you’re having suicidal tendencies, or experiencing any symptoms that significantly impact your thinking, safety or the safety of those around you, you will be asked to seek immediate help offline and not use this site. These resources can provide you with immediate help worldwide.
afterHeader: The employee moodbox enables you to regularly track and record how you feel about certain aspects of your job.
StyledSimpleText: We also want to understand how this could change over time and hope this will enable your company to make adequate improvements to the workplace environment where ever it is needed most.
StyledSimpleText2: We will never share specifically who this data has come from so rest assured, your responses are treated with the upmost confidentiality, ie. they are anonymous.
modalCompPara1: Now, we’re going to ask you some questions about how your work affects your mental wellbeing. We call this feature “Moodbox”.
modalCompPara2: Moodbox helps you see changes in your mental wellbeing over time. Go to your SupportRoom dashboard, and choose wellbeing meter to monitor and view your progress throughout your therapy journey.
modalCompPara3: Your Moodbox answers are available to your employer - don’t worry, it’s totally anonymous. Use your responses as a way of letting your employer know how you’re coping and recording how you’re feeling right now.
moodCheckerPara: Why not add information in your Mood box so that you can track your progress over time.
moodRating: Using the emoji’s below, how would you rate your current mood?
surveyQues: What is the most important topic you would like your organisation to focus on improving this month?
budgetPlan: Choose a plan that suits your budget
chooseAnotherSubs: If you wish to change your package you need to cancel this subscription and select another.
subscriptionCancelPara1: Kindly note that if you are cancelling your subscription in a different country to where you initially purchased it, you will not be able to renew or purchase a new plan until you return back to your home country.
subscriptionCancelPara2: If you have moved country spermanently and would like to change plan or purchase a new subscription you will need to contact support.
subscriptionCancelPara3: Please confirm you still want to cancel your subscription?
changeSubsPara1: If you choose another plan, your subscription will automatically update at the end of this current subscription

testBlockPayment: You'll be asked to enter your payment details to access unlimited messaging therapy access with a counsellor. It's entirely up to you how long you wish to continue for.

gymPassText: SupportRoom connects you with qualified therapists from your smartphone, tablet, or desktop. By in-app messaging, text, voice messaging, or video. 24-hour support: when you need it the most.
supportWhenYouNeed: Support when you need it. 24/7 access.

checkItem3: No waiting. No judgement. Real therapists.

generalText1: sometimes but not all of us have the time to do it...
generalText2: What if we could have the tools to track what’s going on in our lives?
generalText3: Our therapists are available to message when you need them. You can
generalText6: and get their response when they come online.
generalText7: Besides online therapy, SupportRoom offers access to a

helpText1: If you’re having suicidal tendencies, or experiencing any symptoms that significantly impact your thinking, safety or the safety of those around you, you will be asked to seek immediate help offline and not use this site. These resources can provide you with immediate help worldwide.
question1: Are you having these thoughts currently and plan to act on them?
text_Block1: Ensuring you have the resources you need
text_Block2: Thank you for being so honest. We'd advice anyone having thoughts of self harm to seek immediate help.
text_Block3: The resources below are here for you, should you need them at any stage.
text_Block4: These can also be found in your Support Room account
text_Block5: Now, let's continue your therapist journey.
text_Block6: We encourage you to seek help immediately
text_Block7: It’s crucial to act now and get local professional support with feelings of suicide and self harm.
text_Block8: We advise you immediately call your local GP and follow their guidance for the next few weeks.
text_Block9: SupportRoom is still here for you. We will end this journey here for now and be ready to connect with you after this cloud has past.
text_Block10: We encourage you to seek help immediately
text_Block11: It’s crucial to act now and get local professional support.
text_Block12: We advise you immediately call your local GP and follow their guidance for the next few weeks.
text_Block13: SupportRoom is still here for you. We will end this journey here for now and be ready to connect with you after this cloud has past.

privacyPolicyContent: Welcome to MysupportRoom Ltd’s privacy policy
privacyPolicyContent1: MySupportRoom Ltd (“we”) respects your privacy and is committed to protecting your personal data. This privacy policy will inform you as to how we look after your personal data when you visit our website or our apps supportroom.com and mysupportroom.com (regardless of where you visit them from), the purposes for which these data are collected as well as how it is processed, and tell you about your privacy rights and how the law protects you. You can rest assured that your personal data is handled with care. If you want to contact us, you will find our contact details at the end of this policy.
privacyPolicyContent2: A reference to Psychologists means the self-employed and employed practitioners who provide therapy and related services to users. The relationship between us and the Psychologists is explained in more detail in our terms and conditions (www.supportroom.com).
privacyPolicyContent4: Personal data means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person, such as your contact information, your browsing history or information you provide about your mental health.
privacyPolicyContent5: 2. General principles for personal data processing by us
privacyPolicyContent6: We adhere to the following principles when processing your personal data:
privacyPolicyContent7: We will only collect personal data for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes
privacyPolicyContent8: We will not collect personal data beyond what is necessary to accomplish those purposes
privacyPolicyContent9: We will not use personal data for purposes other than that for which the data was collected, except as stated herein, or with prior consent
privacyPolicyContent10: We will not transfer personal data to third parties, except as stated herein, or with prior consent
privacyPolicyContent11: We do pass analysed data to an organisation that has purchased a digital ESP for their organisation and employees. Employee anonymised data is aggregated and represented as charts
privacyPolicyContent12: We will do our best to ensure that information is up to date by encouraging you to verify your personal data periodically
privacyPolicyContent13: We will maintain appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against accidental or unlawful destruction or accidental loss, alteration, unauthorized disclosure or access and against all other unlawful forms of processing
privacyPolicyContent14: Except when stated herein, we will not store personal data longer than is necessary to accomplish the purpose for which the data were collected or for which they are further processed, or as is required by law
privacyPolicyContent15: 3. Personal data we collect and process
privacyPolicyContent16: We may collect, use, store and transfer different kinds of personal data about you which we have grouped together as follows
privacyPolicyContent18: includes first name, last name, username or similar identifier, date of birth, title, and gender.
privacyPolicyContent20: includes billing address, delivery address, email address and telephone numbers.
privacyPolicyContent22: includes details about payments to and from you and other details of services you have purchased from us.
privacyPolicyContent24: includes internet protocol (IP) address, your login data, browser type and version, time zone setting and location, browser plug-in types and versions, operating system and platform, and other technology on the devices you use to access our site or our apps.
privacyPolicyContent26: includes your username and password, the services you have used on our site or our apps, your use of social media functions on our site or our apps, your interests, preferences, feedback, survey responses and such information about your health as you provide to us.
privacyPolicyContent28: includes information about how you use our website or apps and the services you use.
privacyPolicyContent30: includes your preferences in receiving marketing from us and our third parties and your communication preferences.
privacyPolicyContent32: you may provide us with information about your mental health as part of what we term therapy journey or the automated survey. Automated survey is where you complete an online assessment questionnaire to assist you with choosing a Psychologist and to assist the Psychologist with understanding the mental health issues with which you need help.
privacyPolicyContent33: We also collect, use and share Aggregated Data such as statistical or demographic data for any purpose. Aggregated Data could be derived from your personal data but is not considered personal data in law as these data will not directly or indirectly reveal your identity. For example, we may aggregate your Usage Data to calculate the percentage of users accessing a specific website feature. However, if we combine or connect Aggregated Data with your personal data so that it can directly or indirectly identify you, we treat the combined data as personal data which will be used in accordance with this privacy policy.
privacyPolicyContent34: We do collect Special Category of Personal Data about your health (usually as you sign up as a user and need to provide initial information about your mental health to a Psychologist or during your consultations with a Psychologist). We must process Health Data in order to provide services to you as a User. Based on the exemption that Special Categories of Data may be processed in order to provide health care, the Company is entitled to process Health Data you have provided the Company.
privacyPolicyContent35: We do not collect Special Category Data about your race or ethnicity, religious or philosophical beliefs, sex life, sexual orientation, political opinions, trade union membership, and genetic and biometric data) except for information you provide about your health at any time (usually this will be when you sign up and need to provide some initial information about your mental health to a Psychologist). Nor do we collect any information about criminal convictions and offences.
privacyPolicyContent36: We do not collect Financial Data such as payment card details. All payments are managed by Stripe.
privacyPolicyContent37: We also collect, use and share
privacyPolicyContent39: such as statistical or demographic data for any purpose. Aggregated Data could be derived from your personal data but is not considered personal data in law as these data will not directly or indirectly reveal your identity. For example, we may aggregate your Usage Data to calculate the percentage of users accessing a specific website feature. However, if we combine or connect Aggregated Data with your personal data so that it can directly or indirectly identify you, we treat the combined data as personal data which will be used in accordance with this privacy policy.
privacyPolicyContent40: 4. How is your personal data collected?
privacyPolicyContent41: We use different methods to collect data from and about you including through: Direct interactions. You may give us your Identity and Contact by filling in forms or by corresponding with us by post, phone, email or otherwise. This includes personal data you provide when you:
privacyPolicyContent43: create an account on our site or via our apps;
privacyPolicyContent44: subscribe to our service or publications;
privacyPolicyContent45: request marketing to be sent to you;
privacyPolicyContent46: enter a competition, promotion or survey; or
privacyPolicyContent47: give us feedback or contact us.
privacyPolicyContent49: As you interact with our platform, we will automatically collect Technical Data about your equipment, browsing actions and patterns. We collect this personal data by using cookies and other similar technologies like pixels, tags and other identifiers in order to remember your preferences, to understand how our website and apps are used and to customize our marketing offerings. We may also receive Technical Data about you if you visit other websites employing our cookies. Please see our
privacyPolicyContent51: Third parties or publicly available sources.
privacyPolicyContent52: We will receive personal data about you from various third parties and public sources as set out below:
privacyPolicyContent53: Technical Data from the following parties:
privacyPolicyContent54: analytics providers (some of which are based outside the EU) such as Google Analytics, Hubspot, Hotjar, Google, Facebook, Hootsuite, Typeform, Meltwater
privacyPolicyContent55: advertising networks such as Google, Facebook, Apple, Snapchat (some of which are based outside the EU) ; and
privacyPolicyContent57: Contact and Transaction Data from providers of technical, payment and delivery services such as Stripe Inc based outside the EU.
privacyPolicyContent58: Identity and Contact Data from data brokers or aggregators such as Facebook and Google based outside the EU.
privacyPolicyContent59: Identity and Contact Data from publicly available sources such as Companies House and the Electoral Register based inside the EU.
privacyPolicyContent60: 5. How we use your personal data
privacyPolicyContent61: We will only use your personal data when the law allows us to. Most commonly, we will use your personal data in the following circumstances:
privacyPolicyContent62: Where we need to perform the contract we are about to enter into or have entered into with you.
privacyPolicyContent63: Where it is necessary for our legitimate interests (or those of a third party) and your interests and fundamental rights do not override those interests.
privacyPolicyContent64: Where we need to comply with a legal obligation.
privacyPolicyContent65: Generally, for processing your personal data although we will get your consent before sending third party direct marketing communications to you via email or text message or before processing any personal data relating to your health (which usually only occurs when you first sign up with us before you speak with a Psychologist as part of the digital triage process described above). You have the right to withdraw consent to marketing at any time by contacting us.
privacyPolicyContent66: 6. Purposes for which we will use your personal data
privacyPolicyContent67: We have set out below, in a table format, a description of all the ways we plan to use your personal data, and which of the legal bases we rely on to do so. We have also identified what our legitimate interests are where appropriate.
privacyPolicyContent68: Note that we may process your personal data for more than one lawful ground depending on the specific purpose for which we are using your data. Please contact us if you need details about the specific legal ground we are relying on to process your personal data where more than one ground has been set out in the table below.
privacyPolicyContent71: Lawful basis for processing including basis of legitimate interest
privacyPolicyContent72: To register you as a new customer
privacyPolicyContent75: Performance of a contract with you
privacyPolicyContent76: To process and deliver your order including:
privacyPolicyContent77: (a) Manage payments, fees and charges (note that we do not collect you payment information)
privacyPolicyContent78: (b) Collect and recover money owed to us
privacyPolicyContent79: (c) Confirm your scheduled appointment and to send you a push notification before the start of your session
privacyPolicyContent82: (a) Performance of a contract with you
privacyPolicyContent83: (b) Necessary for our legitimate interests (to recover debts due to us)
privacyPolicyContent84: To manage our relationship with you which will include:
privacyPolicyContent85: (a) Notifying you about changes to our terms or privacy policy
privacyPolicyContent86: (b) Asking you to leave a review or take a survey
privacyPolicyContent89: (a) Performance of a contract with you
privacyPolicyContent90: (b) Necessary to comply with a legal obligation
privacyPolicyContent91: (c) Necessary for our legitimate interests (to keep our records updated and to study how customers use our products/services)
privacyPolicyContent92: To enable you to partake in a prize draw, competition or complete a survey
privacyPolicyContent94: (b) Necessary for our legitimate interests (to study how customers use our products/services, to develop them and grow our business)
privacyPolicyContent95: To administer and protect our business and this website (including troubleshooting, data analysis, testing, system maintenance, support, reporting and hosting of data)
privacyPolicyContent97: (a) Necessary for our legitimate interests (for running our business, provision of administration and IT services, network security, to prevent fraud and in the context of a business reorganisation or group restructuring exercise)
privacyPolicyContent98: (b) Necessary to comply with a legal obligation
privacyPolicyContent99: To deliver relevant website content and advertisements to you and measure or understand the effectiveness of the advertising we serve to you
privacyPolicyContent100: Necessary for our legitimate interests (to study how customers use our products/services, to develop them, to grow our business and to inform our marketing strategy)
privacyPolicyContent101: To use data analytics to improve our website, products/services, marketing, customer relationships and experiences
privacyPolicyContent102: Necessary for our legitimate interests (to define types of customers for our products and services, to keep our website updated and relevant, to develop our business and to inform our marketing strategy)
privacyPolicyContent103: To make suggestions and recommendations to you about goods or services that may be of interest to you
privacyPolicyContent104: Necessary for our legitimate interests (to develop our products/services and grow our business)
privacyPolicyContent105: To create custom audiences or lookalike audiences on Facebook to help us advertise our service
privacyPolicyContent107: (b) Necessary for our legitimate interests (to develop our products/services and grow our business)
privacyPolicyContent109: We may use your Identity, Contact, Technical, Usage and Profile Data to form a view on what we think you may want or need, or what may be of interest to you. This is how we decide which products, services and offers may be relevant for you (we call this marketing).
privacyPolicyContent110: You will receive marketing communications from us if you have requested information from us or purchased services from us and you have not opted out of receiving that marketing.
privacyPolicyContent111: We have two mailing lists. One is for news and updates. The other is for educational content and insights. You can opt out of receiving one or both of them.
privacyPolicyContent112: 7. Where we store and process your personal data
privacyPolicyContent113: As a general principle, your personal data is stored and processed within the European Economic Area (EEA) and the United Kingdom. It may also be processed by staff operating outside the EEA and the United Kingdom who work for us or by one of our suppliers. Such processing may include the processing of your identity information by providers of payment services, which is managed by Stripe. Whenever we transfer your personal data out of the EEA and the United Kingdom, we will ensure a similar degree of protection is afforded to it by ensuring at least one of the following safeguards is implemented:
privacyPolicyContent114: We will only transfer your personal data to countries that have been deemed to provide an adequate level of protection for personal data by the European Commission or the Information Commissioners Office.
privacyPolicyContent115: Where we use certain service providers, we may use specific contracts approved by the European Commission or the Information Commissioners Office which give personal data the same protection it has in Europe.
privacyPolicyContent116: 8. Our disclosure of your personal data to third parties
privacyPolicyContent117: As a general principle, we collect and process data in order to facilitate or improve our services or offers. We will get your express opt-in consent before we share your personal data with any third party for marketing purposes.
privacyPolicyContent118: We may disclose your personal data to third parties to the extent required by law, court order or a decision rendered by a competent public authority and for the purpose of law enforcement. In addition, we may share your personal data with the following third parties:
privacyPolicyContent119: Psychologists for the purposes of furthering a contract between us and you in relation to our services.
privacyPolicyContent120: Our Clinical Lead for the for the purposes of furthering a contract between us and you in relation to our services.
privacyPolicyContent121: Third parties carrying out services on our behalf, including billing, sales, marketing, IT support, advertising, analytics, research, customer service, data storage, validation, security, fraud prevention, payment processing, and legal services. Such third-party vendors have access to perform these services but are prohibited from using your personal data for other purposes.
privacyPolicyContent122: Third parties in order to establish, exercise or defend our legal rights.
privacyPolicyContent123: Third parties in the event of any merger, sale, joint venture, assignment, transfer or other disposition of all or any portion of our assets (including without limitation in connection with any bankruptcy or similar proceedings).
privacyPolicyContent124: Other third parties subject to your consent.
privacyPolicyContent125: When we disclose your personal data to a third party, we take all reasonable steps to ensure that those third parties are bound by confidentiality and privacy obligations with respect to the protection of your personal data. The disclosure is conducted in compliance with legal requirements, including entering into data processing agreements with the relevant third parties, to ensure that personal data is only processed in accordance with our instructions, applicable law and regulations and for the purpose specified by us and to ensure adequate security measures.
privacyPolicyContent127: We will only use your personal data for the purposes for which we collected it, unless we reasonably consider that we need to use it for another reason and that reason is compatible with the original purpose. If you wish to get an explanation as to how the processing for the new purpose is compatible with the original purpose, please contact us.
privacyPolicyContent128: If we need to use your personal data for an unrelated purpose, we will notify you and we will explain the legal basis which allows us to do so.
privacyPolicyContent129: Please note that we may process your personal data without your knowledge or consent, in compliance with the above rules, where this is required or permitted by law.
privacyPolicyContent131: We have put in place appropriate security measures to prevent your personal data from being accidentally lost, used or accessed in an unauthorised way, altered or disclosed. In addition, we limit access to your personal data to those employees, agents, contractors and other third parties who have a business need to know. They will only process your personal data on our instructions and they are subject to a duty of confidentiality.
privacyPolicyContent132: We have put in place procedures to deal with any suspected personal data breach and will notify you and any applicable regulator of a breach where we are legally required to do so.
privacyPolicyContent133: All information you provide to us is stored on our secure servers. Any payment transactions will be managed by Stripe and will be encrypted.
privacyPolicyContent134: Unfortunately, the transmission of information via the internet is not completely secure. Although we will do our best to protect your personal data, we cannot guarantee the security of your data transmitted to our site; any transmission is at your own risk. Once we have received your information, we will use strict procedures and security features to try to prevent unauthorised access.
privacyPolicyContent135: The video sessions with Psychologists are not recorded. We periodically test the security of our systems to check for vulnerabilities.
privacyPolicyContent137: We keep your information for no longer than necessary for the purposes for which it is collected. The length of time for which we retain information depends on the purposes for which we collected and use it.
privacyPolicyContent138: Personal data related to our services is kept and processed for a period of seven (7) years from the last date of service, unless such data is legitimately processed for other purposes, such as providing you with personal benefits or customized direct marketing upon your consent or for pursuing our legal claims, where maintaining such information is considered necessary.
privacyPolicyContent139: Personal data related to your use of our site or our apps is kept and processed for a period of seven (7) years from the date you last have been active in using our site or our apps.
privacyPolicyContent140: Personal data related to our provision of direct marketing to you is kept and processed for a period of three (3) years from the date you last have been active in opening our marketing communication or otherwise showing interest in such communication.
privacyPolicyContent141: Relevant personal information will be deleted after expiry of the above-mentioned periods, unless such data legitimately can be kept and processed for other processing purposes for which we have legal basis.
privacyPolicyContent143: We use cookies and similar technologies like pixels, tags and other identifiers in order to remember your preferences, to understand how our site and our apps are used and to customize our marketing offerings.
privacyPolicyContent144: Further details can be found in our
privacyPolicyContent147: We are the data controller. We use external third parties to process data, which include the following:
privacyPolicyContent148: Amazon Web Services, 91200 Pacific Tower 1200 12th Ave S98144 which provides services needed to operate our website and apps (UK data servers).
privacyPolicyContent149: Stripe, Inc which manages payments (note that we do not collect financial information, which you will provide directly to Stripe).
privacyPolicyContent150: Psychologists, self-employed psychologists who provide services to users.
privacyPolicyContent152: Interns (who may provide services for us)
privacyPolicyContent153: Mailgun (EU and USA) (who send emails on our behalf)
privacyPolicyContent154: Twillio (USA) (who send the sms on our behalf)
privacyPolicyContent155: Whatsapp (USA) (who send sms on our behalf)
privacyPolicyContent161: Access to your personal data and data portability
privacyPolicyContent162: You have the right to access the personal data we hold about you. You have the right to request the transfer of your personal data to you or to a third party. We will provide to you, or a third party you have chosen, your personal data in a structured, commonly used, machine-readable format. Note that this right only applies to automated information which you initially provided consent for us to use or where we used the information to perform a contract with you.
privacyPolicyContent163: Updating and/or deleting your personal data
privacyPolicyContent164: We encourage you to update your personal data provided to us any time there are changes in your personal data.Your personal data can be deleted from our servers unless we are entitled or obliged by applicable law and regulations to keep and process such information regardless of withdrawal of your consent.
privacyPolicyContent165: Following your request for deletion of your personal data, these will be deleted from our servers without undue delay; please note it may take a period of up to two (2) months to ensure complete deletion of any information stored in our back-up.
privacyPolicyContent166: You may also contact us to review, update or delete personal data stored about you. For relevant contact details please see section 18 below. Please note that prior to accessing and requesting changes to your data, we will need to verify your identity properly.
privacyPolicyContent167: Right to restriction of processing, right to object and marketing preferences
privacyPolicyContent168: You have the right to restrict processing of your personal data if the personal data is not correct, or if the processing is unlawful, in the event that you oppose erasure of your personal data, if we no longer needs your personal data for the purposes of processing but storing such data is requested by you for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims, or if you have objected to processing and verification and a decision about whether we still have a legitimate interest in the given personal data is pending. Please see section 18 for relevant contact details.
privacyPolicyContent169: At any time you have the right to object to processing of your personal data that has been collected and processed for the purposes of legitimate interests pursued by us, for instance when we make your future bookings easier by remembering your details or when we conduct analytics and statistics on your use of our services. Please see section 18 for relevant contact details.
privacyPolicyContent170: You can ask us to stop sending you marketing messages at any time or by following the opt-out links on any marketing message sent to you or by contacting us at any time.
privacyPolicyContent171: Where you opt out of receiving these marketing messages, this will not apply to personal data provided to us as a result of a product/service purchase, warranty registration, product/service experience or other transactions.
privacyPolicyContent173: Some of our processing activities may be based on your consent. In these situations you will have the right to withdraw your consent at any time. Withdrawal of your consent will not affect the lawfulness of processing conducted prior to the withdrawal.
privacyPolicyContent174: If you withdraw your consent, we and third parties involved in personal data processing will cease to process your personal data, unless and to the extent the continued processing or storage is permitted or required according to the applicable personal data legislation or other applicable laws and regulations. Please note that as a consequence of your withdrawal of your consent, we may not be able to meet your requests or provide you with our services.
privacyPolicyContent176: If you want to complain about a privacy breach, please contact us by sending your complaint to by post or email to the address or email address shown at the bottom of this policy.
privacyPolicyContent177: We will acknowledge receipt of your complaint within five (5) business days. We will do our best to resolve it as quickly as possible and within one (1) month from the date of complaint. In case a response would require longer than one (1) month, we will let you know and inform you of the relevant reason(s).
privacyPolicyContent178: You have the right to make a complaint at any time to the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO), the UK supervisory authority for data protection issues (www.ico.org.uk). We would, however, appreciate the chance to deal with your concerns before you approach the ICO so please contact us in the first instance.
privacyPolicyContent181: Our website and apps may contain links to third party websites and plug-ins, for instance a social media login plug-in. If you choose to use these websites, plug-ins or services you may disclose your information to those third parties. We are not responsible for the content or practices of those websites, plug-ins or services. The collection, use, and disclosure of your personal data will be subject to the privacy policies of these third parties and not this Privacy Policy. We urge you to read the privacy and security policies of the relevant third parties.
privacyPolicyContent183: We do not target and our website and apps are not intended to attract children. Accordingly, our online services that collect personal data are not directed at and should not be accessed by individuals under the age of sixteen (16) years, and we request that such individuals do not provide any personal data to us. Minors must obtain express consent from parents or legal guardians prior to accessing or providing any personal data. If notified by a parent or guardian, or discovered by other means, that a child under the age of sixteen has provided his or her personal data to us we will delete the child’s personal data that is in our possession.
privacyPolicyContent185: We may modify or update this Privacy Policy when necessary to reflect changes in our products and services, changes in applicable legislation, regulations or practice and to address customer feedback. Accordingly, please review it periodically. The date of the latest update is always provided on the top of the document.
privacyPolicyContent187: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or the processing of your personal data, please contact us at:
privacyPolicyContent188: Mysupportroom Ltd, 20-22 Wenlock Road, London, England, N1 7GU.
privacyPolicyContent189: Alternatively please send an e-mail to Info@supportroom.com
privacyPolicyContent190: MySupportRoom Ltd is a company incorporated and registered in England and Wales with company number 12554309 whose registered office is at Mysupportroom Ltd, 20-22 Wenlock Road, London, England, N1 7GU.

therapyFeedback2: How would you rate your therapy experience so far?

therapistQual1: Please upload any qualifications you may have as a professional therapist.
therapistQual2: Files must be in JPG, PNG or PDF format.
therapistQual3: Such as LPC, LMHC, PhD or other recognised professional licence, certification or proof of accreditation.
therapistQual4: This can be a passport, driving licence or other Government issued identification.
therapistQual5: Please provide a DBS check certificate obtained within the last 3 years. If you are outside the UK then a Police clearance certificate in your current country of residence is required.
sendAttachment: Send an attachment to your therapist
journal1: The Journal entry you are looking for cannot be found.
windowText1: Searching for the next available therapist, this can take up to 7 minutes.
windowText2: Your first session is booked on
windowText3: but you can message your therapist at any time. Your therapist will message you back when they're available. If you need urgent support click on the urgent button in the top right.
windowText4: Message your therapists at any time and they will come back to you as soon as possible.
asmaQuote: Sharing your thoughts and feelings is important for your mental health and at  SupportRoom we have made this easy and accessible. SupportRoom allows you to connect at your convenience to help make you feel better today.
claireQuote: Using SupportRoom is simple and is so easy to access when it suits you. I like the way my availability is shown and the choice on how an individual wants to talk to me is given to them. I feel this is key to getting the support how you want and when you need it.
kaananQuote: I would absolutely recommend support room to my own loved ones A unique and innovative way to bring quality mental health support, primarily through messaging therapy, into the hands of those that need it, when they need it

helpLineContent2: Over 3,300 groups in the UK, help drinkers to stay sober and to help other alcoholics to achieve sobriety. Fellowship of men and women share their experience, strength and hope with each other that they may solve their common problem and help others to recover from alcoholism
helpLineContent4: Helpline for anyone concerned about drug or solvent misuse. Advice and information for drug misusers, their families, friends, carers. (Formerly known as the National Drugs Helpline).
calendarData: View your patients booked video session & set your weekly availability
